title: Honors
text:

title: Jing Wang
text:
Hello, I’m Jing Wang, a Ph.D. student in the Department of Statistics at Univerisity of Connecticut. My research focuses on subsampling algorithms, rare-events data analysis, and transfer learning. I am currently working as a teaching assistant and a research assistant in the Department of Statistics at Uconn.

Education

University of Connecticut, Sep. 2021-present
Ph.D. student in Statistics
Academy of Mathematics and Systems Science,
Chinese Academy of Sciences, Sep. 2018-Jun. 2021
M.S. in Statistics
Central South University, Sep. 2014-Jun. 2018
B.S. in Mathematics and applied mathematics



Positions

Department of statistics, University of Connecticut,
Research assistant, Storrs, CT, Jan., 2022-present
Department of statistics, University of Connecticut,
Teaching assistant, Storrs, CT, Sep., 2021-present
Academy of Mathematics and Systems Science,
Chinese Academy of Sciences,
Research assistant, Beijing, China, Sep., 2019-Jun.2021



Teaching Experiences

STAT 1000Q. Introduction to Statistics I (027D-029D), Fall 2022
STAT 1100Q. Elements of Statistics (018D,032D), Spring 2023



Skills

Programming languages: julia, R, python, Matlab
Editorial tool: LaTeX, Emacs, VS code
Other tools: Linux, git, github

title: Publications
text:
Wang Jing, Zou Jiahui, and Wang HaiYing (2022). Sampling with replacement vs Poisson sampling: a comparative study in optimal sampling. IEEE Transactions on Information Theory, 68(10), 6605-6630.
Wang Jing, Wang HaiYing, and Xiong Shifeng (2022). Unweighted estimation based on optimal sample under measurement constraints. Canadian Journal of Statistics.
